alert.note: Alert for Orange County Coastal; San Diego County Coastal Areas (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 11 at 12:55PM PST until January 11 at 6:00PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TO NOON PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 4 to 7 feet, maximum sets to 8 feet. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding expected. * WHERE...San Diego County Coastal Areas and Orange County Coastal Areas. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, until 6 PM PST this evening. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 6 AM to noon PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of parking lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...King Tides continue on Friday. High tide of 6.74 feet at La Jolla will occur at 8:59 AM Friday morning, which could lead to additional minor coastal flooding and beach erosion.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.

area.areaDesc: Orange County Coastal; San Diego County Coastal Areas
